channel.title: Fake cnn syria footage
channel.description: Hey have you guys seen the fake CNN news on Syria lately I mean it looks so fake it's like their not even trying to make it look credible. Edit: Is anybody there?

item.title: Fake cnn syria footage
item.dc:creator: Zen609
item.description:
Dr. Karamazov:

Shiiit. So are you telling me that my crabs are going to give me typhus?

Since you seem to be a fan of both Russia and lice:

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16323139

Read full topic

item.title: Fake cnn syria footage
item.dc:creator: Dr_Karamazov
item.description:
Rabbiddog:

So a friend, who does cancer research at Johns Hopkins, and I were sitting in this joint and shoveling crab dip into our ugly maws when he just out of the blue quips, “I wonder how much people would enjoy crabs if they actually knew how many carcinogens it contained.”

So I pause, a mouthful of crab dip and just stare at him. Thought for a moment, then swallowed and replied, “Whelp, if I’m gonna die, then I’m gonna die enjoying life.” and continued eating.

Shiiit. So are you telling me that my crabs are going to give me cancer? Or is it just the sea crabs?:fffuuu: I’ve grown attached to my pubic crabs. I’ve named them all.

Read full topic

item.title: Fake cnn syria footage
item.dc:creator: Zen609
item.description:
Right - the idea and the website itself aren’t funny, but that he remembered this and dug it out to post in this thread was (at least to me). He’s comparing OPs fluoride phobia with the DHMO hoax - and that’s spot-on. It was a good use of the website. When he posted it, I was like “ahahahaha - right, that’s exactly what’s happening here. Good catch.”

Read full topic

item.description:
bur:

“water is poisonous!!!” is about the oldest joke in the world

It’s old - late 90s - IIRC it’s a high school science fair project. There are still a lot of people that don’t understand it’s meaning.

One of the best trolls ever, just behind Black Mesa.

Read full topic

item.title: Fake cnn syria footage
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
https://www.dhmo.org/
Wake up sheeple!

Although the U.S. Government and the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) do not classify Dihydrogen Monoxide as a toxic or carcinogenic substance (as it does with better known chemicals such as hydrochloric acid and benzene), DHMO is a constituent of many known toxic substances, diseases and disease-causing agents, environmental hazards and can even be lethal to humans in quantities as small as a thimbleful.

But by all means, continue with the conversations, like I said, entertaining.

item.title: Fake cnn syria footage
item.dc:creator: Zen609
item.description:
This isn’t a study, it’s an opinion piece on a special interest site opposing fluoridation.

It’s not well-written and the argumentation is really very bad. It’s basically a bunch of word salad. It doesn’t make any sort of case, even rhetorically, that fluoridated water causes Alzheimer’s Disease.

You should follow the links to the National Cancer Institute and the CDC for information regarding the effects of fluoride on health, rather than just random articles by interested parties. There are plenty of good sources for information regarding most subjects on the internet, but probably more that aren’t good sources. Articles like this are not good sources.

Now, go brush your teeth, and use a toothpaste with fluoride - I promise it won’t give you AIDS.

Read full topic

item.title: Fake cnn syria footage
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
There are also studies showing that fluoridated water could be a contributing factor in Alzheimer’s disease.
https://www.nofluoride.com/Alzheimer%27s_in_America.cfm

Read full topic

item.title: Fake cnn syria footage
item.dc:creator: Zen609
item.description:
Here are some interesting facts about fluoridated water:

https://www.cancer.gov/cancertopics/factsheet/Risk/fluoridated-water

https://www.cdc.gov/fluoridation/

Also, fluoride is not added to water in continental Europe, but to salt. The dramatic rise is life expectancy in Western countries in the 20th century is largely attributed to advancements in dental health, as common dental infections weaken the heart over a period of years resulting in a shortened life span due to heart disease.

Floss or die!

Read full topic

item.title: Fake cnn syria footage
item.dc:creator: Zen609
item.description:
@ Winged One

Right - I think that a lot of people, at least in the US, grow up with some assumptions that they learn from their parents, teachers, coaches, church, and local community in general, and at some point in their development, discover that most of this stuff isn’t true or correct. I think that’s the case for most of us, and we work this out in our teens or twenties, maybe when we leave home for college or move away from the farm or small town, etc.

But the problem for some people is that there are plenty of interested parties who are more than happy to explain “The Truth” to them - like Alex Jones, Glenn Beck, or any one of hundreds of people who make their living writing books, lecturing, hosting radio shows selling conspiracy theories of all sorts - political, economic, historical, religious, scientific, etc.

Dr. Karamazov:

wait…who said anything about Putin?

The clip you posted was RT.

Read full topic

item.title: Fake cnn syria footage
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
I once dropped acid with a guy who believed in the Illuminati and all that bullshit and wouldn’t shut the fuck up about how they control everything and perform ritual sacrifices to the devil and spread chem trails and the music industry is a puppet and etc. Completely and utterly ruined my trip with his nonsense.

Relegate that shit to fiction. It works in Assassin’s Creed. Not in real life. It just amounts to arrogant people who think they’re the only ones who aren’t brainwashed looking for interesting conspiracy in a world where, in most cases, and apple is and apple. They are bored with accepting the status quo so they weave fiction into reality. Again, awesome to do in movies or video games. It’s interesting to think about. But in most cases it isn’t real.

Are there things we aren’t told? Yes. Is information sometimes skewed to sell a product? Yes. Does the person with the most money (ie. big business) run the government? For the most part, yes. But is there some grand tinfoil hat conspiracy in control of the world that places all of their symbols right where the public can see them? No. And if there is some grand secret society conspiracy in the works, you will never know about it. That’s sort of the point of a secret society.

Read full topic

item.title: Fake cnn syria footage
item.dc:creator: Zen609
item.description:
coldroll:

I don’t believe in any of that conspiracy crap I just don’t believe in stupid videos like this:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T1v5eQLCj_s

Well, this video was posted by a conspiracy theorist. His other clips are 9/11 and 7/7 conspiracy clips, and , interestingly, an old chestnut, the fluroridated water conspiracy, which originated from the John Birch Society as paranoid anti-communist propaganda in the 50s.

… and some Illuminati and Freemason clips, too.

Read full topic
